org.knime.core.node.util

Class CheckUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.node.util.CheckUtils

  • public final class CheckUtils
extends Object
    Static check functions used during settings loading etc.
    Since:
    2.10
    Author:
    Marcel Hanser, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Method Detail

      • checkArgumentNotNull

        public static <T> T checkArgumentNotNull(T toCheck,
                                         String template,
                                         Object... templateArgs)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the given object to be not null. If the check fails the exception is thrown containing the message resulting from String.format(String, Object...) with the given template and arguments.
        Note: the string is only formatted if the exception is actually thrown.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object
        Parameters:
        toCheck - the object which may not be null
        template - the string template which determines the exception message
        templateArgs - the arguments for the string formating
        Returns:
        the argument itself
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null
        NullPointerException - if template is null

      • checkArgumentNotNull

        public static <T> T checkArgumentNotNull(T toCheck)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Checks the given object to be not null. The exception message in case of null is 'Argument must not be null'.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the object
        Parameters:
        toCheck - the object which may not be null
        Returns:
        the argument itself
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null
        Since:
        2.12

      • checkDestinationFile

        public static String checkDestinationFile(String urlOrPath,
                                          boolean allowOverwrite)
                                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        Does several checks for the given destination location in case it's a local file, e.g. it it's a file, if it's writable (if it exists). Warnings are returned as strings, error cause an InvalidSettingsException. For remote URLs no checks are performed except if the URL is non-empty.
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - the destination location, can be an URL or a file system path
        allowOverwrite - true if an existing file may be overwritten, false if overwriting is forbidden
        Returns:
        null or a warning message
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if there will be a problem when writing to the file
        Since:
        2.11

      • checkDestinationFile

        public static String checkDestinationFile(String urlOrPath,
                                          boolean allowOverwrite,
                                          boolean mustExistForAppend)
                                   throws InvalidSettingsException
        Does several checks for the given destination location in case it's a local file, e.g. it it's a file, if it's writable (if it exists). Warnings are returned as strings, error cause an InvalidSettingsException. For remote URLs no checks are performed except if the URL is non-empty.
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - the destination location, can be an URL or a file system path
        allowOverwrite - true if an existing file may be overwritten, false if overwriting is forbidden
        mustExistForAppend - true if the output location must already exist, e.g. for appending to an existing file
        Returns:
        null or a warning message
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if there will be a problem when writing to the file
        Since:
        2.11

      • checkDestinationDirectory

        public static String checkDestinationDirectory(String urlOrPath)
                                        throws InvalidSettingsException
        Does several checks for the given destination location, e.g. it it's a directory and if it's writable. Warnings are returned as strings, error cause an InvalidSettingsException. For remote URLs no checks are performed except if the URL is non-empty.
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - the destination location, can be an URL or a file system path
        Returns:
        null or a warning message
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if there will be a problem when writing to the directory
        Since:
        2.11

      • checkSourceFile

        public static String checkSourceFile(String urlOrPath)
                              throws InvalidSettingsException
        Does several checks for the given source location, e.g. if it's a file and if it's readable. Warnings are returned as strings, error cause an InvalidSettingsException. For remote URLs no checks are performed except if the URL is non-empty.
        Parameters:
        urlOrPath - the source location, can be an URL or a file system path
        Returns:
        null or a warning message
        Throws:
        InvalidSettingsException - if there will be a problem when reading the file
        Since:
        2.11
